intro: Cyperus varicus var. simpliciusculus, commonly known as the slender flatsedge, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with triangular stems. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, demonstrating its adaptability to moist environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish or brownish in color. This variant is distinguished by its shorter, more compact growth compared to other members of the Cyperus varicus species.
